channel.title: Need some advice
channel.description:
Okay, So I recently wanted to install Linux (Ubuntu desktop version 9.04) though I'd like to dual boot. Since this is a school computer, I'd like to have the choice of both Windows 7 and Linux.
Now, I have linux on the computer I'm currently on, but I was not the one that installed it, My buddy that lives like 3~ hours away did.
Could anyone send me a tutorial or give me some tips that could help me while I'm installing?
Thanks in advance.

item.title: Need some advice
item.dc:creator: @P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut `Lewk_
item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

Okay, I’m currently in Ubuntu atm, Just booted from a disk.

Thanks for the help, guys.

Read full topic

item.title: Need some advice
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

Download Wubi; it’s an easy way to dual boot as it does it for you.

http://wubi-installer.org/

Read full topic

item.title: Need some advice
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

https://help.ubuntu.com/9.04/installation-guide/i386/index.html

This is more that enough. tbh Ubuntu is fuck easy to install. Its mainly graphical. Only hard thing is setting BIOS to boot from CD first, but most of the time it is set like this so you should have no problems.

I like Cookies.

Read full topic
